title: Portland Quarry Walk Route

images.caption: Tout Quarry Sculpture Park. The sculpture park started off in 1983, while the site also become a nature reserve around 2004.

images.title: Chris Gunns / West Cliff from Tout Quarry
images.caption: West Cliff from Tout Quarry

description: This walk visits the Tout Quarry Sculpture Park & Nature Reserve on the Isle of Portland in Dorset. This abandoned stone quarry has now been converted into a splendid sculpture park with miles of walking trails to try. The popular attraction includes a sculptures by famous artist's such as Anthony Gormley. From the high points there are also glorious views over Chesil Beach. In the summer months there's also lots of wild flowers attracting a varierty of butterflies. To continue your walking in the area you could pick up the circular Isle of Portland Walk and visit the Portland Bill lighthouse.
display_address: Tradecroft, Portland, Weston, Dorset, England, DT5 2LN, United Kingdom
